metadata.description: Important intermediate verbs - emotions, cognition, and complex actions

present.spanish: Me lavo las manos antes de cada comida.
present.english: I wash my hands before every meal.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te lavas el pelo con champú especial.
present.english: You wash your hair with special shampoo.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te lavás los dientes tres veces al día.
present.english: You brush your teeth three times a day.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se lava la cara con agua fría cada mañana.
present.english: He/She washes his/her face with cold water every morning.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Nos lavamos las manos después de trabajar en el jardín.
present.english: We wash our hands after working in the garden.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Os laváis los pies después de caminar en la playa.
present.english: You all wash your feet after walking on the beach.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Se lavan las manos frecuentemente en el hospital.
present.english: They wash their hands frequently at the hospital.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me lavé las manos inmediatamente después del accidente.
preterite.english: I washed my hands immediately after the accident.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te lavaste el pelo con el nuevo champú.
preterite.english: You washed your hair with the new shampoo.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Te lavaste las manos con jabón antibacterial.
preterite.english: You washed your hands with antibacterial soap.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Se lavó la cara con agua tibia antes de dormir.
preterite.english: He/She washed his/her face with warm water before sleeping.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Nos lavamos completamente después de la excursión.
preterite.english: We washed ourselves completely after the excursion.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Os lavasteis los pies en el río durante el picnic.
preterite.english: You all washed your feet in the river during the picnic.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Se lavaron las heridas con agua oxigenada.
preterite.english: They washed their wounds with hydrogen peroxide.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Me lavaré las manos antes de preparar la cena.
future.english: I will wash my hands before preparing dinner.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te lavarás el pelo en la peluquería nueva.
future.english: You will wash your hair at the new salon.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Te lavarás los dientes después del postre.
future.english: You will brush your teeth after dessert.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Se lavará las manos antes de la cirugía.
future.english: He/She will wash his/her hands before surgery.
future.subject: él/ella/usted

future.spanish: Nos lavaremos en el lago durante el campamento.
future.english: We will wash ourselves in the lake during camping.
future.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Os lavaréis después de trabajar en el huerto.
future.english: You all will wash yourselves after working in the garden.
future.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Se lavarán las manos antes de entrar al laboratorio.
future.english: They will wash their hands before entering the laboratory.
future.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Me quedo en casa los fines de semana para descansar.
present.english: I stay home on weekends to rest.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te quedas siempre hasta muy tarde en la oficina.
present.english: You always stay very late at the office.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te quedás a dormir en casa de tu abuela.
present.english: You stay to sleep at your grandmother's house.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se queda en el hospital para cuidar a su madre.
present.english: He/She stays at the hospital to take care of his/her mother.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Nos quedamos en el mismo hotel cada año.
present.english: We stay at the same hotel every year.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Os quedáis en casa cuando llueve mucho.
present.english: You all stay home when it rains a lot.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Se quedan despiertos para ver el amanecer.
present.english: They stay awake to see the sunrise.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me quedé dormido durante la película aburrida.
preterite.english: I fell asleep during the boring movie.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te quedaste sin palabras cuando viste la sorpresa.
preterite.english: You were speechless when you saw the surprise.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Te quedaste en Buenos Aires todo el verano.
preterite.english: You stayed in Buenos Aires all summer.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Se quedó en la biblioteca hasta que cerró.
preterite.english: He/She stayed at the library until it closed.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Nos quedamos despiertos toda la noche hablando.
preterite.english: We stayed awake all night talking.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Os quedasteis en silencio durante el concierto.
preterite.english: You all remained silent during the concert.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Se quedaron impresionados con la presentación.
preterite.english: They were impressed with the presentation.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Me quedaré en casa para estudiar este fin de semana.
future.english: I will stay home to study this weekend.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te quedarás sorprendido con los resultados.
future.english: You will be surprised with the results.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Te quedarás a vivir en España después de graduarte.
future.english: You will stay to live in Spain after you graduate.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Se quedará trabajando hasta muy tarde hoy.
future.english: He/She will stay working until very late today.
future.subject: él/ella/usted

future.spanish: Nos quedaremos en París una semana más.
future.english: We will stay in Paris one more week.
future.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Os quedaréis boquiabiertos con el espectáculo.
future.english: You all will be amazed by the show.
future.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Se quedarán en el hotel hasta el domingo.
future.english: They will stay at the hotel until Sunday.
future.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Me voy a casa después del trabajo.
present.english: I'm leaving for home after work.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te vas muy temprano de las fiestas.
present.english: You leave parties very early.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te vas de vacaciones la próxima semana.
present.english: You're going on vacation next week.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se va del país por motivos de trabajo.
present.english: He/She is leaving the country for work reasons.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Nos vamos de la ciudad este fin de semana.
present.english: We're leaving the city this weekend.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Os vaís de España después del curso.
present.english: You all are leaving Spain after the course.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Se van de la empresa para empezar su propio negocio.
present.english: They're leaving the company to start their own business.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me fui de la reunión porque era muy aburrida.
preterite.english: I left the meeting because it was very boring.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te fuiste sin despedirte de nadie.
preterite.english: You left without saying goodbye to anyone.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Te fuiste de Buenos Aires con mucha tristeza.
preterite.english: You left Buenos Aires with great sadness.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Se fue de casa a los dieciocho años.
preterite.english: He/She left home at eighteen years old.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Nos fuimos del restaurante sin pagar la cuenta.
preterite.english: We left the restaurant without paying the bill.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Os fuisteis del concierto antes del final.
preterite.english: You all left the concert before the end.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Se fueron del hotel muy temprano por la mañana.
preterite.english: They left the hotel very early in the morning.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Me iré de esta ciudad cuando termine mis estudios.
future.english: I will leave this city when I finish my studies.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te irás de viaje de luna de miel a Italia.
future.english: You will go on your honeymoon trip to Italy.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Te irás a vivir al extranjero el próximo año.
future.english: You will go live abroad next year.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Se irá de la empresa después de veinte años.
future.english: He/She will leave the company after twenty years.
future.subject: él/ella/usted

future.spanish: Nos iremos de vacaciones a la montaña.
future.english: We will go on vacation to the mountains.
future.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Os iréis de intercambio a América Latina.
future.english: You all will go on exchange to Latin America.
future.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Se irán del país por la crisis económica.
future.english: They will leave the country because of the economic crisis.
future.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Me pongo nervioso antes de los exámenes.
present.english: I get nervous before exams.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te pones muy elegante para las citas.
present.english: You dress very elegantly for dates.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te ponés contento cuando llueve.
present.english: You get happy when it rains.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se pone el abrigo cuando hace frío.
present.english: He/She puts on the coat when it's cold.

present.spanish: Nos ponemos tristes cuando termina el verano.
present.english: We get sad when summer ends.

present.english: You all put on your shoes before leaving.

present.spanish: Se ponen felices cuando ven a sus nietos.
present.english: They get happy when they see their grandchildren.

preterite.english: I got furious when I heard the news.

preterite.spanish: Te pusiste el vestido azul para la boda.
preterite.english: You put on the blue dress for the wedding.

preterite.spanish: Te pusiste muy contento con la sorpresa.
preterite.english: You got very happy with the surprise.

preterite.english: He/She got sick after eating seafood.

preterite.spanish: Nos pusimos los uniformes para el partido.
preterite.english: We put on our uniforms for the game.

preterite.spanish: Os pusisteis muy serios durante la reunión.
preterite.english: You all became very serious during the meeting.

preterite.spanish: Se pusieron nerviosos antes de la entrevista.
preterite.english: They got nervous before the interview.

future.english: I will put on the new suit for graduation.

future.spanish: Te pondrás muy feliz cuando veas el regalo.
future.english: You will get very happy when you see the gift.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Te pondrás la camiseta de tu equipo favorito.
future.english: You will put on your favorite team's jersey.

future.spanish: Se pondrá muy orgulloso de sus logros.

future.spanish: Nos pondremos los abrigos para el viaje al norte.

future.english: You all will get very excited with the news.

future.spanish: Se pondrán los cascos antes de entrar a la obra.

present.spanish: Me siento muy cómodo en esta casa.
present.english: I feel very comfortable in this house.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te sientes mejor después de hacer ejercicio.
present.english: You feel better after exercising.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te sentís orgulloso de tus logros académicos.
present.english: You feel proud of your academic achievements.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo recibido.
present.english: He/She feels grateful for all the support received.

present.spanish: Nos sentimos muy unidos como familia.
present.english: We feel very united as a family.

present.spanish: Os sentís felices cuando estáis juntos.
present.english: You all feel happy when you're together.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Se sienten seguros en su nuevo barrio.
present.english: They feel safe in their new neighborhood.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me sentí muy emocionado durante la ceremonia.
preterite.english: I felt very excited during the ceremony.

preterite.spanish: Te sentiste decepcionado con los resultados.
preterite.english: You felt disappointed with the results.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Te sentiste como en casa desde el primer día.
preterite.english: You felt at home from the first day.

preterite.spanish: Se sintió aliviado cuando terminó el examen.
preterite.english: He/She felt relieved when the exam ended.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Nos sentimos muy orgullosos de nuestro hijo.
preterite.english: We felt very proud of our son.

preterite.spanish: Os sentisteis incómodos durante la discusión.
preterite.english: You all felt uncomfortable during the argument.

preterite.spanish: Se sintieron bienvenidos en la nueva empresa.
preterite.english: They felt welcome at the new company.

future.spanish: Me sentiré mucho mejor después de las vacaciones.
future.english: I will feel much better after vacation.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te sentirás muy orgulloso cuando te gradúes.
future.english: You will feel very proud when you graduate.

future.spanish: Te sentirás como en casa en tu nuevo trabajo.
future.english: You will feel at home in your new job.

future.spanish: Se sentirá aliviado cuando resuelva el problema.
future.english: He/She will feel relieved when he/she solves the problem.

future.spanish: Nos sentiremos muy felices en nuestra nueva casa.
future.english: We will feel very happy in our new house.

future.spanish: Os sentiréis muy emocionados con el viaje.
future.english: You all will feel very excited about the trip.

future.spanish: Se sentirán muy agradecidos por la ayuda.
future.english: They will feel very grateful for the help.

present.spanish: Pienso en mis vacaciones de verano.
present.english: I think about my summer vacation.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Piensas mucho antes de tomar decisiones.
present.english: You think a lot before making decisions.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Pensás que es una buena idea mudarse.
present.english: You think it's a good idea to move.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Piensa que el proyecto va a funcionar.
present.english: He/She thinks the project is going to work.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Pensamos igual sobre muchas cosas.
present.english: We think alike about many things.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Pensáis en el futuro con optimismo.
present.english: You all think about the future with optimism.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Piensan en sus familias constantemente.
present.english: They think about their families constantly.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Pensé mucho antes de tomar esa decisión importante.
preterite.english: I thought a lot before making that important decision.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Pensaste que era una broma pero era en serio.
preterite.english: You thought it was a joke but it was serious.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Pensaste que no ibas a poder pero lo lograste.
preterite.english: You thought you wouldn't be able to but you did it.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Pensó en su familia durante todo el viaje.
preterite.english: He/She thought about his/her family during the entire trip.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Pensamos que llegaríamos tarde pero llegamos a tiempo.
preterite.english: We thought we would be late but we arrived on time.

preterite.spanish: Pensasteis que el examen sería fácil.
preterite.english: You all thought the exam would be easy.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Pensaron que era imposible hasta que lo vieron.
preterite.english: They thought it was impossible until they saw it.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Pensaré en una solución durante el fin de semana.
future.english: I will think of a solution during the weekend.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Pensarás diferente cuando tengas más experiencia.
future.english: You will think differently when you have more experience.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Pensarás en mí cuando estés lejos.
future.english: You will think of me when you're far away.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Pensará en jubilarse después de los sesenta.
future.english: He/She will think about retiring after sixty.

future.spanish: Pensaremos en mudarnos a una ciudad más pequeña.
future.english: We will think about moving to a smaller city.

future.spanish: Pensaréis en las consecuencias antes de actuar.

future.spanish: Pensarán que estamos locos por este proyecto.

preterite.spanish: Entendiste la lección mejor que todos.

preterite.spanish: Entendiste perfectamente lo que quería decir.
